etymology.description: 厦(廈 ‘mansion; large building’) + 门(門 ‘gate’) = ‘gate of a grand building,’ extended to mean a strategic sea-gate and adopted as the city name.
etymology.interpretation: Literally ‘gate of a mansion,’ evoking a grand portal to the sea and to Fujian’s trade routes. Commonly understood as a maritime gateway guarding important approaches.
etymology.simplification: Both characters were simplified for stroke economy: 廈 → 厦 (radical reduced; inner parts streamlined) and 門 → 门 (door-frame reduced), easing handwriting and printing.

parts.english: mansion; tall building; large house; used in place names
door; gate; entrance; classifier for branches of study

examples.chinese: 厦门位于福建省东南部，濒临台湾海峡(廈門位於福建省東南部，瀕臨臺灣海峽)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàmén wèiyú Fújiàn shěng dōngnán bù, bīnlín Táiwān Hǎixiá.
examples.english: Xiamen is in southeastern Fujian, facing the Taiwan Strait.

examples.chinese: 我们明天坐高铁去厦门旅游(我們明天坐高鐵去廈門旅遊)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen míngtiān zuò gāotiě qù Xiàmén lǚyóu.
examples.english: We will take the high-speed rail to travel to Xiamen tomorrow.

examples.chinese: 名称“厦门”字面为“大厦之门”，比喻海上门户(名稱「廈門」字面為「大廈之門」，比喻海上門戶)。
examples.pinyin: Míngchēng “Xiàmén” zìmiàn wéi “dàshà zhī mén”, bǐyù hǎishàng ménhù.
examples.english: The name literally means “gate of a grand building,” a metaphor for a maritime gateway.
